sense.name: a painful, pus-filled sore, infection
sense.examples: The doctor lanced the boil in the man's ear. The plague was characterized by large, pus_filled boils on the victim's face.

sense.name: the temperature at which a liquid boils, bubbles
sense.examples: Bring the soup to a boil before serving. When the sauce is just at the boil, remove it from the heat. This river is known for its massive current differentials, boils and braided channels. (metaphoric extension, turbulent water)

sense.name: an outdoor seafood meal, usually southern style
sense.examples: The family enjoyed a traditional Louisiana boil on the beach. This seafood restaurant has a lobster boil every Wednesday from five to nine.

sense.name: a seasoning mixture used to enhance seafood
sense.examples: Chef Tom's seafood boil contains paprika, black pepper, mustard and other spices. Mary bought a packet of crab boil in the seafood market.

sense.name: a state of intense excitement
sense.examples: The issue finally came to a boil at town meeting last night.
